explanation: Agent A is correct. In OS_ConsoleCreate_Impl the variable "console" is only used for read access (console->IsAsync) and the pointed-to object is not modified through this pointer. MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 recommends that pointers should point to const-qualified types whenever possible, so "console" should be declared as const OS_console_internal_record_t *console. Assigning the result of the OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET macro (which yields a non-const pointer) to a const-qualified pointer is allowed, so making this change is safe and would remove the rule violation. Note: the other local pointer "local" is used for writable operations (sem_init/sem_destroy) and therefore must remain non-const.
